messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] to Hikuru
messages.msgSnippet: Suzanne, If you don t get any replies here, I have friends in Japan who run a school which teaches English.  I don t know if they have email, but I will check.
messages.messageBody:
Suzanne,

If you don't get any replies here, I have friends in Japan who run a school
which teaches English. I don't know if they have email, but I will check.
Either way, I could pass along questions, or you could write them. Let me
know if you want me to do this.

many blessings,
erin
----- Original Message -----
From: "Suzanne Ackerson" <sylvanv@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, January 11, 2003 6:27 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] to Hikuru


> Hikaru,
>
> I don't know if you saw my post about hoping to get info from Americans
who have taught English to kids in Japan, but since I didn't get a reply I'm
wondering if you have done this or know of anyone who has. My 21 year old
son will be graduating from college in May and is going to apply for this
job. I wish he'd choose a place closer to home but I certainly understand
the need for learning and independence, plus his strong interest in Japan
and its people. If you know of this program and have any suggestions or
annecdotal info, I'd appreciate it. He's learned both Japanese alphabets in
the last month.
>
> Thanks,
> Suzanne
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>

messages.subject: to Hikuru
messages.msgSnippet: Hikaru, I don t know if you saw my post about hoping to get info from Americans who have taught English to kids in Japan, but since I didn t get a reply I m
messages.messageBody:
Hikaru,

I don't know if you saw my post about hoping to get info from Americans who have taught English to kids in Japan, but since I didn't get a reply I'm wondering if you have done this or know of anyone who has. My 21 year old son will be graduating from college in May and is going to apply for this job. I wish he'd choose a place closer to home but I certainly understand the need for learning and independence, plus his strong interest in Japan and its people. If you know of this program and have any suggestions or annecdotal info, I'd appreciate it. He's learned both Japanese alphabets in the last month.

Thanks,
Suzanne

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
